item.title: A Poor Guy's Local PHP Apm
item.description: I’ve seen the benefits of instrumenting code for a very long time: with PHP, Go, Frontend Javascript, and more recently, NodeJS. When you have access to a full APM solution like I do at work (Newrelic), or on the side (with Elastic APM), it becomes easy to see at a glance not only what transactions (API calls, queued jobs, asynchronous processes, etc) are taking a long time, but also why.
